1520651746_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJV.body:
> [krixano](#comment_3_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): You can change the language on ZeroHello by clicking the three dots next to the logo. 

I already know that, but I would like zeronet to display another language by default from the fresh installed start. 

For example, `python2 zeronet.py --lang=zh`, so that I don't need to click the three-dot and so forth. 

>This changes the language for the sidebar on all zites and for ZeroHello. It doesn't change for other zites because that's dependent on the creators of those zites.

Thank u for ur kind explanation. ZeroTalk is also affected. (because @nofish owns it?)

> [krixano](#comment_4_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Are you saying it resets everytime you restart the client? I didn't know that.

I don't know either. But what I want is like this:

1. wget zeronet to my empty fresh HDD.
2. start zeronet with some hacking.
3. 127.0.0.1:43110 shows HelloZeronet with another language rather than English without touching the three-dot menu or anything.

> [krixano](#comment_7_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): ZeroTalk actually is not affected because there are clones for specific languages.

As I tested yesterday and now, if I modify the language setting in HelloZeroNet, not only ZeroTalk but also ZeroTalk cloned sites show the changed language menus.

> [krixano](#comment_8_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Do you mean on the actual zite or on the sidebar that you get to by swiping over the 0 button in the top right? 

Actual sites like ZeroTalk and its derivatives. For example, if I switch the language from `en` to `zh`, ZeroTalk main page title is converted from `Newest topics` to `最新的话题` including other menus such as `+ Start new topic` and so on, everything.

> [krixano](#comment_9_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): I see what the problem was. It changes for ZH, but not for the language that I was selecting when I originally tried it (DE). So it only works for some languages.

Oh, in case of `DE`, ZeroTalk/languages/ folder doesn't have `de.json` file. :p

There're da, fr, hu, it, pl, sk, uk, zh-tw, zh.

How can I add `ko.json`?
